info.title: SqlManagementClient
info.description: The Azure SQL Database management API provides a RESTful set of web APIs that interact with Azure SQL Database services to manage your databases. The API enables users to create, retrieve, update, and delete databases, servers, and other entities.

get.description: Gets a list of all managed instances in the subscription.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of managed instances.

get.description: Gets a list of managed instances in a resource group.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of managed instances.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 SubscriptionNotFound - The requested subscription was not found.

 * 404 ManagedInstanceNotInSubscriptionResourceGroup - Specified managed instance does not exist in the specified resource group and subscription.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveManagedInstance - The requested managed instance was not found

 * 404 ResourceNotFound - The requested resource was not found.

 * 409 ConflictingManagedInstanceOperation - An operation is currently in progress for the managed instance.

 * 429 SubscriptionTooManyRequests - Requests beyond max requests that can be processed by available resources.

 * 429 ConflictingSubscriptionOperation - An operation is currently in progress for the subscription.

 * 429 SubscriptionTooManyCreateUpdateRequests - Requests beyond max requests that can be processed by available resources.

 * 503 TooManyRequests - Requests beyond max requests that can be processed by available resources.

 * 504 RequestTimeout - Service request exceeded the allowed timeout.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the specified managed instance.

put.description: Creates or updates a managed instance.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The requested managed instance resource state.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 SubscriptionNotFound - The requested subscription was not found.

 * 400 RegionDoesNotAllowProvisioning - The selected location is not accepting new Windows Azure SQL Database servers. This may change at a later time.

 * 400 VnetAddressRangeError - Virtual network address range is invalid.

 * 400 VnetConfigIsNotAllowed - Virtual network configuration is not allowed.

 * 400 InvalidParameterValue - An invalid value was given to a parameter.

 * 400 InvalidLoginName - The provided login name is invalid.

 * 400 PasswordTooShort - The provided password is too short

 * 400 PasswordTooLong - The provided password is too long.

 * 400 NameAlreadyExists - The provided name already exists.

 * 400 PasswordNotComplex - The provided password is not complex enough.

 * 400 RegionDoesNotSupportVersion - A user attempted to create a server of a specified version in a location where that server version isn't supported.

 * 400 TokenTooLong - The provided token is too long.

 * 400 InvalidLocation - An invalid location was specified.

 * 400 InvalidServerName - Invalid server name specified.

 * 400 InvalidIdentifier - The identifier contains NULL or an invalid unicode character.

 * 400 InvalidSubnetResourceId - The provided subnet resource ID for the managed instance create or update is invalid.

 * 400 VnetInWrongRegion - Virtual network is in wrong region.

 * 400 ServerNotFound - The requested server was not found.

 * 400 InvalidUsername - Supplied user name contains invalid characters.

 * 404 ManagedInstanceNotInSubscriptionResourceGroup - Specified managed instance does not exist in the specified resource group and subscription.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveManagedInstance - The requested managed instance was not found

 * 404 OperationIdNotFound - The operation with Id does not exist.

 * 404 ResourceNotFound - The requested resource was not found.

 * 409 OperationCancelled - The operation has been cancelled by user.

 * 409 OperationInterrupted - The operation on the resource could not be completed because it was interrupted by another operation on the same resource.

 * 409 SubscriptionDisabled - Subscription is disabled.

 * 409 ServerDisabled - Server is disabled.

 * 409 ServerQuotaExceeded - Server cannot be added to a subscription because it will exceed quota.

 * 409 ServerAlreadyExists - Duplicate server name.

 * 500 OperationTimedOut - The operation timed out and automatically rolled back. Please retry the operation.

*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 SubscriptionNotFound - The requested subscription was not found.

 * 404 ManagedInstanceNotInSubscriptionResourceGroup - Specified managed instance does not exist in the specified resource group and subscription.

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveManagedInstance - The requested managed instance was not found

 * 404 OperationIdNotFound - The operation with Id does not exist.

 * 404 ResourceNotFound - The requested resource was not found.

 * 409 ConflictingManagedInstanceOperation - An operation is currently in progress for the managed instance.

 * 409 OperationCancelled - The operation has been cancelled by user.

 * 409 OperationInterrupted - The operation on the resource could not be completed because it was interrupted by another operation on the same resource.

 * 429 SubscriptionTooManyRequests - Requests beyond max requests that can be processed by available resources.

 * 429 ConflictingSubscriptionOperation - An operation is currently in progress for the subscription.

 * 429 SubscriptionTooManyCreateUpdateRequests - Requests beyond max requests that can be processed by available resources.

 * 500 OperationTimedOut - The operation timed out and automatically rolled back. Please retry the operation.

 * 503 TooManyRequests - Requests beyond max requests that can be processed by available resources.

 * 504 RequestTimeout - Service request exceeded the allowed timeout.

204.description: The specified managed instance does not exist.

parameters.description: The requested managed instance resource state.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

ManagedInstanceProperties.description: The properties of a managed instance.

fullyQualifiedDomainName.description: The fully qualified domain name of the managed instance.

administratorLogin.description: Administrator username for the managed instance. Can only be specified when the managed instance is being created (and is required for creation).

administratorLoginPassword.description: The administrator login password (required for managed instance creation).

subnetId.description: Subnet resource ID for the managed instance.

state.description: The state of the managed instance.

licenseType.description: The license type. Possible values are 'LicenseIncluded' and 'BasePrice'.

storageSizeInGB.description: The maximum storage size in GB.

identity.description: The Azure Active Directory identity of the managed instance.

ManagedInstanceUpdate.description: An update request for an Azure SQL Database managed instance.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the request.

ResourceGroupParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupParameter.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.

ManagedInstanceNameParameter.name: managedInstanceName
ManagedInstanceNameParameter.description: The name of the managed instance.

BlobAuditingPolicyNameParameter.name: blobAuditingPolicyName
BlobAuditingPolicyNameParameter.description: The name of the blob auditing policy.

VirtualClusterNameParameter.name: virtualClusterName
VirtualClusterNameParameter.description: The name of the virtual cluster.
